content.text1: We believe that we are created for relationship with God and with each other. When we come together in our neighbourhoods and invite others, something powerful happens. Ready to meet new friends and build relationships?

“I wanted to spiritually find myself, but I didn't know how to do that. I pondered for a while about where I should go or what I could do. Is there such a thing as a church that isn't so uptight? Is there a place I could go to learn more?”

image1.alt: Woman standing infront of a building on a bright sunny day.

content.text1: When we're not practicing social distancing because of COVID-19, these are the ways we typically connect.

list.title: Sunday Morning
list.text: Curiouys but not sure what to expect? We gather to learn how we can grow as followers of Jesus who love others well. Due to COVID-19, we have transitioned our physical gatherings to online every Sunday at 10:00am EDT.
list.imageAlt: Three people standing by the doors of the Oakville site

list.title: Home Church
list.text: *In response to COVID-19 our home churches have transitioned to online gatherings.* During the week, we meet in homes to study and apply Sunday's teaching, build relationships in smaller groups, and care for our neighbourhoods. We call this Home Church—and it's kind of the best thing we've got going.
list.imageAlt: Three people sitting around a dining room table eating snacks

list.title: Kids & Youth
list.text: We work together to create a safe community where our kids and youth can learn to love and follow Jesus. We do this through building relationships, equipping parents, and developing our own curriculum. Learn more about our programs.

image1.alt: A man sitting outside on a ledge and looking up at the sky.

content.text2: We'd love to keep you in the loop about events, stories, and other important updates. We promise we won't spam you.
